item.title: Unified Communications for the SMB
item.description: By: John Shepler Large companies have embraced unified communications (UC) to enhance their business phone systems and employee productivity. item.title: Your Cell Phone IS Your Business Phone System

When they call your mobile number, you’re reachable regardless of location. You can always let calls go to voicemail, eliminating the need to rush back to the office just to check messages.

item.title: Advantage of Independent Toll Free Numbers
item.description: Toll-free numbers offer significant benefits for businesses of all sizes, particularly in sales and customer service. An independent toll-free number operates separately from your landline or mobile phone bill, allowing you to direct incoming calls to any phone number you choose and easily modify this routing as needed.

item.title: Flat Rate vs Per Minute Toll Free Service
item.description: Almost every business that sells directly to consumers needs a toll-free number. Customers expect a free way to contact businesses for orders or customer support. Having to pay for a call might make them reconsider and choose a competitor. It’s similar to free WiFi—its absence makes businesses seem less appealing. However, there are two types of toll-free services: pay-per-minute and flat-rate. With a flat rate, businesses pay a fixed monthly fee regardless of call volume.
